title: Market Recap: Friday, January 15: Stocks drop for 2nd day
text: #Stockmarket #stocks #investing Stocks dipped as traders considered details of President-elect Joe Biden's newly unveiled stimulus proposal. COVID-19 concerns also flared anew as stay-in-place restrictions tightened across parts of Europe, and new data showed U.S. retail sales unexpectedly fell for a third straight month in December.

title: Economy Can Handle Overheating From Biden's Stimulus Plan: Summers
text: Jan.15 -- Former U.S. Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers, a Wall Street Week contributor and adviser to Pres.

title: Investors Should be Concerned About Inflation: Tett
text: Jan.15 -- Financial Times Editorial Board Chair Gillian Tett says investors should be concerned about inflationary pressures, because of an upsurge in growth that could come from a combination of vaccine distribution and a big stimulus package. She joins David Westin on "Bloomberg Wall Street Week.

title: Negative News of Past Few Months Finally Hit Markets: Beschloss
text: Jan.15 -- RockCreek Founder and Chief Executive Officer Afsaneh Beschloss said that the negative news of Covid-19 and the slow pace of vaccine distributions is finally hitting markets. She hopes to see natural forces driving markets by the third quarter of 2021 so that the Fed can start "taking its foot off the pedal.

title: Fear Comes to the Stock Market. What Comes Next.
text: The S&P 500's first weekly drop of more than 1% since Halloween is a sign that investors, unflappable until now, were taken aback by what they saw.

title: Positive Start to Q4 Earnings Season
text: We are off to a great start in Q4 earnings season, with the big banks coming out with a notably improved profitability picture relative to what they were able to show in preceding periods. This reconfirms our view of a steadily improving earnings outlook that we have been highlighting over the last few months.

title: Jim Cramer reacts to first batch of bank earnings ahead of Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo reports
text: Wait three days, they buy JPMorgan, the best of breed, or Wells Fargo, the turnaround play, "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer recommended.

title: Cramer's week ahead: Opportunities are abounding, but must be spotted first
text: "There are opportunities abounding, you just need to spot them first and figure out if they're trades or investments," "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer said.

title: There Is Legitimate Reason For Economic Concern (Technically Speaking For The Week Of 1/11-1/15)
text: There are still a number of positive economic indicators. However, there are issues in the labor market, retail sales, and income.

title: BCM 4Q20 Market Commentary: Looking Back to Move Forward—Seeking Higher Ground in an Imperfect World
text: By The BCM Investment Team Much will be written about the challenges, difficulties, pain and suffering endured by humanity in 2020. We would like to focus on some of the good that came out of last year's strife: Our Democracy, while far from perfect, works.

title: Josh Brown: If you have been a buyer on other people's fear it has worked time and time again
text: The market hardly reacted to the events at the Capitol. CNBC's Josh Brown says that is becase the markets are focused on the future.

title: How Invesco is approaching ETFs in 2021 after record year
text: Invesco's head of ETFs breaks down the industry's prospects for the year ahead.

title: We need to get these fiscal packages passed, says Stephanie Link
text: Stephanie Link, Hightower chief investment strategist and portfolio manager, joins 'Closing Bell' to give her insight on Biden's vaccination plan moving forward.

title: Biden Pitches Stimulus Checks Now, Tax Hikes Soon To Beat Virus, Inequality; Dow Jones Falls
text: The $1.9-trillion Joe Biden plan to speed recovery won't include tax hikes. Yet President-elect Biden's tax talk got the Dow Jones off to a poor start Friday.

title: The Dow Fell 177 Points Because More Stimulus Is News, Not a Catalyst
text: Stocks fell Friday after President-elect Joe Biden assured that more fiscal stimulus was on the way. “Buy the rumor, sell the news” seemed to rule the day.

title: Biden heads into inauguration with a stock market tailwind
text: Joe Biden moves into the White House in the coming week with the biggest stock market tailwind since Election Day for possibly any president in history.

title: 'Bloomberg Real Yield': Powell Bats Down Taper Talk
text: Jan.15 -- Diana Amoa, senior portfolio manager at JPMorgan Asset Management, discusses the possibility of the Fed tapering its bond purchases. She speaks with Bloomberg's Lisa Abramowicz on “Bloomberg Real Yield.

title: Stock Market Today: New Stimulus Plan Fails to Stimulate Stocks
text: Did Wall Street just "sell the news"? Stocks decline a day after Biden unveils $1.9 trillion "American Rescue Plan.

title: Dow ends down over 170 points after disappointing December retail sales
text: U.S. stock-market benchmarks finished lower on Friday, booking weekly losses after a third straight drop in retail sales highlighted weakness in consumer spending at the turn of the year. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 177 points, or 0.6%, to 30,814, based on preliminary numbers.

title: Why this analyst thinks the energy sector has room to grow until 2030
text: Exxon shares are lower after the Wall Street Journal reported the company is undergoing an SEC probe. Roger Reed, Wells Fargo senior analyst, upgraded Exxon back in December.

title: Gramercy's El-Erian, Koenigsberger on Fed, Credit, EM Outlook
text: Jan.15 -- Gramercy Funds Chair Mohamed El-Erian and founder and Chief Investment Officer Robert Koenigsberger discuss Federal Reserve policy, credit markets, and the outlook for emerging markets on "Bloomberg Markets.000" El-Erian is a Bloomberg Opinion columnist, his opinions are his own.

title: Pays to be selective in the retail space: Josh Brown
text: Josh Brown, Ritholtz Wealth Management, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss the decline of retail sales numbers for the third straight month and what it means for the stocks in the sector.

title: 2021 Equity Market Outlook
text: Interest rates, while rising now, remain well below where they were a year ago and still remain a bullish factor for stocks. Even as the S&P 500 Index closed out 2020 at a record high, earnings for the S&P 500 Index are expected to be down 12% from a year ago.

title: U.S. Weekly FundFlows Insight Report: Despite A Slight Downturn, High Yield Municipal Bond Funds Attract Record Inflows For The Fund-Flows Week
text: Investors were overall net purchasers of fund assets for the third week in four. They injected $22.9 billion for Refinitiv Lipper's fund-flows week ended January 13, 2021.

title: Oil futures fall for the session; U.S. prices pare their gain for the week
text: Oil futures declined Friday, prompting U.S. prices to pare their gain for the week, pressured as fresh outbreaks of COVID-19 in China dulled the outlook for energy demand. "China's growing health crisis has led to a fall in oil as it is the largest importer of energy in the world," said David Madden, market analyst at CMC Markets UK.

title: Last Year In A Nutshell
text: In April of last year, I predicted that the shutdown of the US economy would prove to be the most expensive self-inflicted injury in the history of mankind. Unfortunately, I turned out to be right. The shutdown was the perfect "Black Swan" event which shocked the US and the global economies to their foundation.

title: Fed's Rosengren voices support for Biden stimulus proposal
text: Rosengren said he was comfortable with the action despite a nearly $2 trillion price tag that will take the government deeper into the red.

title: MacroView: The Problem With Analysts' Forecasts
text: The biggest single problem with Wall Street, both today and in the past, is the consistent disregard of the possibilities for unexpected, random events. There are certainly many similarities between today and 1999.

title: Stock Market Rally Pauses Amid Trump Impeachment, Biden Stimulus Plan; GM, Nio, Intel, Taiwan Semiconductor, JPMorgan In Focus
text: The stock market rally paused this week amid a new Trump impeachment and a Biden stimulus plan. The major indexes fell, but small caps and many leaders rose.

title: The Fed: Fed's Kashkari says he's not worried about inflation ‘shooting way above' 2% rate
text: There is not much risk that inflation will shoot way above the U.S. central bank's 2% target, said Minnesota Fed President Neel Kashkari on Friday.

title: Market Extra: Majority of investors say higher rates loom as biggest threat to stocks and risky assets from rallying further, says BofA survey
text: Higher rates are beginning to overshadow the buoyant mood in stocks and corporate bonds.

title: The Countervailing Forces Of Fiscal Stimulus And Higher Interest Rates
text: This market has all the characteristics of a bubble, but there are good arguments for the bull market to continue. Fiscal stimulus and the increase in inflation and long-term interest rates that come with it are the countervailing forces on which investors need to focus.

text: CNBC's Rick Santelli reports on consumer sentiment index and business inventories data.

title: Stocks open lower despite strong bank earnings
text: CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" team discuss the opening of U.S. markets as all three indexes head lower.

text: CNBC's Rick Santelli breaks down the latest round of industrial production and capacity numbers.

title: Panic-like buying emerges in Nasdaq Composite despite slump in stock-market index early Friday
text: Trading in the Nasdaq Composite was exhibiting panic-like-buying behavior Friday morning, a day after exhibiting panic-like selling a day ago. The Nasdaq Composite was trading 0.5% lower at 13,041, while the Nasdaq Arms Index, a volume-weighted breadth measure, fell to 0.453.

title: 'Stocks have the green light': Guggenheim's Minerd says massive stimulus will support equities at least through the end of the 1st quarter
text: Guggenheim's Scott Minerd indicated he's bullish on stocks in the near-term during a Thursday CNBC interview. "I'm a pretty conservative guy but right now given the Fed purchase program, the idea that we're gonna get a lot of stimulus out of Washington. I think stocks have a green light," said the global chief investment officer. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell reiterated Thursday that the central bank is far from tapering its asset purchases or raising interest rates, a signal Minerd said will be good for stocks.

title: Market Seems Subdued After Mixed Bank Results, Biden Stimulus Announcement
text: There's a phrase on Wall Street that investors often “buy the rumor and sell the fact.”

title: November JOLTS Report Shows The Renewed Impact Of The Pandemic, Partial Lockdowns
text: This morning's JOLTS report for November (remember - a month in which there were total job gains) showed a jobs market recovery that at least paused due to the increasing effects of the out of control pandemic. While the JOLTS data is a deep dive into the dynamics of the labor market, since it only dates from 2001, there are only 2 previous recoveries with which to compare the present.

title: Cramer says David Tepper thinks it's hard to bet against stocks with Fed backing, vaccine rollout
text: "I don't want to say he's wildly bullish. I would say he's very constructive," CNBC's Jim Cramer said of David Tepper.

title: Retail stocks take a hit after disappointing data, as COVID-19 even weighed on online sellers
text: Shares of retailers traded broadly lower early Friday, to underperform the broader stock market, after economic data showing that December retail sales fell for a third-straight month, and by much more than expected. The data indicated that sales at even internet retailers and electronic stores, which had been standout performers during the COVID-19 pandemic, dropped last month.

title: Retail sales decline for third straight month
text: US retail sales dropped last month, the Commerce Department said Friday, marking the third straight month without any growth.
